todo.title: ReactComponent
todo.body: React lets you define components as classes or functions. Components defined as classes currently provide more features which are described in detail on this page. To define a React component class, you need to extend React.Component

todo.title: React props
todo.body: Conceptually, components are like JavaScript functions. They accept arbitrary inputs (called “props”) and return React elements describing what should appear on the screen.

todo.title: React Lifecycle
todo.body: Each component in React has a lifecycle which you can monitor and manipulate during its three main phases. The three phases are: Mounting, Updating, and Unmounting.

todo.title: React state
todo.body: The state object is where you store property values that belongs to the component. When the state object changes, the component re-renders
